meanings.definition: To burst or shatter violently and noisily as a result of pressure from within.
meanings.sent1: The balloon will explode if you blow too much air into it.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks will explode in the sky during the celebration.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made the balloon explode while trying to inflate it.
meanings.sent4: Her anger seemed to explode like a volcano, surprising everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The bomb was about to explode, creating a deafening noise.

meanings.definition: To increase suddenly in size, number, or extent.
meanings.sent1: The population of the town will explode with the new housing development.
meanings.sent2: The popularity of the song will explode after it plays on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter started to explode out of the mixing bowl, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement seemed to explode as she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The number of customers at the store will explode during the holiday sale.

meanings.definition: To burst forth with sudden force or energy.
meanings.sent1: The volcano will explode with lava and ash during the eruption.
meanings.sent2: The athlete will explode off the starting line in the race.
meanings.sent3: The confetti will explode out of the cannon at the end of the show.
meanings.sent4: His laughter seemed to explode in the quiet room, breaking the tension.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd will explode as the team scores a goal.
